intro: Lonchitis cordigera, commonly known as the heartleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of blue and purple. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes.
